website_summaries.verdict: Between its soft material, ability to catch some major air, and high-visibility colors, the sturdy Paraflight is the ultimate fetch toy.
pros: Multiple layers of stitching for extra durability
Vibrant design is hard to lose outside
Available in small and large sizes
cons: Will be destroyed quickly if left alone as a chew toy

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well for frisbee loving border collie
customer_reviews.text: As a border collie owner I quickly realized the importance of the frisbee. Disc golf frisbees while being able to travel far, are made of a harder plastic. This can be problematic for a dog who loves to catch them in her mouth (teeth, mouth issues). Luckily I found this frisbee which travels well in the air, is soft, but most importantly is durable when we like to turn the frisbee in a tug of war match. Also this thing is easy to wash and dry, having exposed it to all different types of weather climates and terrains. Overall I would suggest this frisbee to other frisbee loving dog owners.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these frisbees. It’s the forth one we’ve bought in a bout a year. The first one lasted quite a while, we lost one, the third one fell apart at the seam in a couple months, and the forth one is separated at the seam again - this time in less than a month. So disappointed because it’s my dogs favorite toy, but I can’t sport buying products that don’t hold up for at least a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Bergamini

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all, even if you baby it
customer_reviews.text: My dog really loves this frisby but sadly it has only lasted about 3 weeks. We never let him tug it, chew on it, or anything. He must drop it before we take it so we don’t pull on it. He doesn’t get access to it after play time so he can’t chew it. Even with all this, it is severely frayed and falling apart. All we do is play catch with it. It’s so unfortunate because it flies so well and he loves to catch it. It doesn’t make his gums bleed like plastic ones. Too bad I’d have to buy a new one every month.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie MTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fly straight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these toys about a year ago. It flew perfectly straight even though my dog ripped up the cloth center. I decided to replace it and bought a two pack. Neither one flew straight. No matter how I try to adjust the flight pattern: speed, tilting of may hand etc, the toy always makes a hard left turn making it impossible for my dog to catch it. What a dissapointment after the first toy worked so well. Update: 2/12/19 - Extremely poor Customer service. I sent an email three weeks ago and never heard back from them. I will never purchase another toy from Chuckit.
customer_reviews.author: JerryT

customer_reviews.title: not very durable
customer_reviews.text: my dog loves it but it did not hold up to his playing with it.. It started falling apart at the top seam within a few days. If it had french seams not regular seam, the seams would hold up better. Update, My dog thoroughly loved this Frisbee but destroyed it. I recently bought a Hyper Pet Flippy Flopper Dog Frisbee that has a rip-stop nylon in the center instead of canvas. The rip-stop nylon and using french seams to sew it together would make this Frisbee almost indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: My one female pit bull does not play fetch and rarely has any interest in toys until she saw this Frisbee in a neighbors yard and went crazy over it. I bought her one and she absolutely loves playing with it and chasing it. She will go non-stop and it makes me happy to see her have so much fun with a toy. The reason for 4 stars is that it is not very durable especially with a big dog. After only a few days of play it was already fraying and ripping. My pup still loves it but it probably won't last more than a summer.
customer_reviews.author: Kickinit

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: We have been using Kong flyer frisbees for years, but when we saw this recommendation, we decided to try it out. With two playful, tug-of-war dogs over 60 pounds each, the Kong usually lasts about four months before we have to replace it. This thing lasted about four days. The string immediately started to unravel, the foam outside layer cake apart, and holes ripped in the canvas.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea G.

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun
customer_reviews.text: This item was a hit with my Aussie shepherd. She really loves catching this. I have to hide it or else she will bug me 24/7 to play. It is durable enough for her ad well since she could destroy anything. But I also keep it from her long enough ad not to chew through the fabric in the middle of the construction of this design. But most dogs can anyways. It's a given with their natural inclination to chew and tear things. So keep track of this as most of you are aware. Over all a great buy and loads of fun if your best friend likes to fetch and catch. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: KrazyKiel

customer_reviews.title: Another good ChuckIT product
customer_reviews.text: While I can only review based on my experience, I am sure there are other dogs who are not as rough on toys as mine. While it is currently staying together after about a dozen frisbee outings, we have already made 2 holes in it along the seam due to my dog's instistence on fighting us for the frisbee about every other time. My dog does enjoy this frisbee as it flies really well and far and the people are enjoying it too because it can hit you if you catch poorly and doesn't hurt.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it, but it fell apart
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE this toy. They have been playing with it non-stop since we purchased it. Unfortunately, this toy fell apart after just a week of playing with it. The seams came apart and then the blue rubber ridge on the outside of the Frisbee fell off. I wish Chuckit toys were more durable. My dogs LOVE playing with them, but they just don't last. I wish this manufacturer would look into more durable manufacturing techniques like sewing seams with more than just one zig-zag stitch. This is the third amphibious Chuckit toy I've purchased, and they've all fallen apart in the same way.
customer_reviews.author: NVChamp

customer_reviews.title: We keep buying this flyer almost every month
customer_reviews.text: Our dog, a border collie, loves this flyer and other ball plays. She chews off this flyer every time we play (and tug-of-war with the flyer), so it becomes unusable within a month. Well, if we use only this one for play, then it won't last a week. Having said that, it's not that durable like other plastic flyers, but I like it this way because it is easy on dogs' teeth. This one is especially a love of my dog as it flies well and is light weight - there's no way to hurt a dog with this Paraflight flyer.
customer_reviews.author: kokomommy

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I have a part pit bull mix dog who tears everything up in seconds so I have to buy extra heavy duty items for her to play with. I love Chuck-it toys.. This one is very light weight so it is easy to fly across the yard so my dog can run and get exercise. She chews on it and shakes it and her and my little beagle play tug of war with it. So far it has held up even with leaving it laying in this hot summer heat all day. We give this product 5 stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable. Wasted my money.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes we’d have a great, durable throw toy. My dog destroyed this on our first outing. We did not play tugofwar. He is able to shake it until it came unraveled and strings go all over. He’s a 14 lb Boston terrier. It lasted only 3 play sessions. I bought 2 and gave 1 to a friend as a gift. Total waste of money. Into the land fill it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Best dog frisbee ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect dog frisbee. Unlike other frisbees, this thing will sail long distances with just a flick of the wrist. Also, my dog (30 lb cavalier spaniel) has a habit of chewing up plastic frisbees and destroying them. I’ve had this thing for over a month now, and it only has a few puncture marks in it. My dog isn’t a water dog, but the fact that it floats is great for when i miss a toss and it goes into the pool. With other frisbees, i have to grab a net and fish it out of the bottom of the pool. Outstanding, very durable product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the teeth.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these for my lab because he had a bunch of front teeth pulled due to cracking-- he had a tough life before I got him-- and I didn't feel a standard or even soft plastic frisbee would be a good idea for him. Don't be fooled by the softness and bendability, these disks handle and fly like a normal plastic one. The disks are very, very durable but not indestructible if your pup is determined. The only complaint I have is that the material they're made of seems very tough to clean. My experience is that once they get muddy they'll always be at least a little dingy looking.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Good Frisbee
customer_reviews.text: My Aussie is so hard on things. She has to carry a frisbee around and has to have multiples. This has a very nice soft edge and that is really Important when you play with it a lot, no busted gums or teeth. It’s pretty sturdy and flys well. The colors make it easy to see in grass or any spot it falls( IF she doesn’t catch it which is almost never ). If it can hold up to my Whispers constant play it gets five stars for me. My only complaint is I wish it was made in USA
customer_reviews.author: Windwish

customer_reviews.title: Great product as long as you put it away after using
customer_reviews.text: It's really a very good product. However, my first purchase of it was horrible..I had choices on who to buy it from on Amazon. My first purchase was like two dollars cheaper than usual and now i know why. So I returned it and bought the one that was a little more expensive on Amazon. I've bought a total of 3 now and have been happy with those. They really fly far and there's a glow in the dark one that works well at night.
customer_reviews.author: Cubae

customer_reviews.title: Much better for your dog’s teeth!
customer_reviews.text: My Belgian Malinois is a frisbee champ. I’ve been using a Hyperflite Jaws X competition disc until, at only a year old, I noticed her canine teeth are already worn flat due to the hard plastic and repetitive use of the Hyperflite. I’ve been trying different fabric substitutions, but none fly as good or as far as the plastic discs. I simply won’t use those anymore - no matter what. This is THE best fabric and foam disc I’ve found yet. It is very easy to throw and it soars! Easy to control and very light. She loves it. I love it! She also loves the ChuckIt Flying Squirrel. Save your dog’s teeth and get this disc!
customer_reviews.author: J. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: didnt last one day
customer_reviews.text: I have an 11 month old shepherd, we got this last night and he loved it! This morning I picked it up to toss and noticed a 3" rip in the seam between light blue cover and orange strip around edge. I really hoped it would have lasted, but another frisbee bit the dust. Orange Nerf frisbee ring isn't good either.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Sookie knows best
customer_reviews.text: I will let my dog tell the story. She waits every day for the Amazon delivery person to arrive with new products. Lucky for me the delivery today was 2 Chuck-it toys. She loves opening the boxes. But number one best thing is the air bladders that protect the contents. After popping them, the real fun begins and she can chase the throw toys. She sez, “the best time of the day is Amazon delivery time”.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Spellman

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required.
customer_reviews.text: This paraflight flyer is perfectly aerodynamic. It flies slow and steady without much effort. They are not very durable at all. Mine fell apart the first day I used it. The second one I got, I bought some adhesive glue and sealed up the seams on top and bottom with a continuous bead and it works perfectly and has lasted a couple of weeks. So, for the price of two flyers and some adhesive and patience, I would recommend this product. Without the adhesive, I would tell you to pass.
customer_reviews.author: Karl E. Hosch

customer_reviews.title: Just OK.
customer_reviews.text: It functions as a frisbee but only moderately well. It has a nice soft ring that is easy on the dog's mouth and seemingly durable fabric top. The problem (I'm guessing) comes from the flexible nature of the fabric top. When thrown the fabric is likely collapsing under the pressure difference that would normally keep a rigid disc aloft much longer/farther. This wouldn't be a problem in a smaller yard. The dog I got this for is absolutely fetch-crazed. Throw virtually anything retrievable and she goes apey trying to get it and bring it back. This tender little morsel of a disc though, she'd rather just chew on. Overall well made like most chuckit products.
customer_reviews.author: Citrus

customer_reviews.title: My Aussie Loves This Frisbee!!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried many styles and brands, but this one is my girl's favorite. It doesn't hold up nearly as well as my second favorite, Hyperflite Jawz Competition Dog Disc, but it has it's own perks. My dog loves to spin in the air and catch this one and it can also bounce off of a tree or any other hard object, which is fun. I would give this product a 5, as I have since purchased this product and would again, but it just doesn't hold up very long (couple months in our case). Still lots of fun though, thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: derrick

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: My lab is a frisbee catcher. She stays engaged longer with the Chuckit Paraflight because they are light and easy to catch, and don't travel too far. I also use the Kong frisbees, but they are heavier and have a longer flight - as a result they tire her out faster. The only downside to the Chuckit Paraflight is my dog also loves to "shake" the frisbee as she returns them, and as a result the foam perimeter of the Chuckit Paraflight will break down. A small price to pay for our enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C

customer_reviews.title: Victory Laps
customer_reviews.text: My girl loves it. She follows me around with it in her mouth bumping the back of my calf reminding me she still wants to play. Very well made and durable. I gave 4star on it because it's been a week and I didn't put it up. She loved it so much she tore it up when I wasn't looking. My fault I guess. Let's just say I will order again and be more careful. She catches it in the air (unlike the plastic ones) and does victory laps
customer_reviews.author: Weaver Alabama Girl

customer_reviews.title: Defective or Possibly ‘Seconds’
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these Chuckit! large paraflight frisbees purchased at a local pet store for YEARS and loved them. They lasted MONTHS with my rough playing aussies. However, All five I ordered from this distributor had difficulty flying in a level manner (they seemed warped) and were easily torn apart/shredded along the rim within two days of playing. Makes me suspect they were defective (not sure how great the odds would be for all 5 to be bad) or more likely they were factory ‘seconds.’
customer_reviews.author: Terri Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Dogs ruined it very quickly
customer_reviews.text: This thing flies wonderfully and I was so into it, I got another one when my dogs destroyed it in such a short amount of time. They are border collies and are pretty rough on their frisbees but the plastic ones last a long time. This fabric one falls apart right away so unfortunately it's not worth the money. Would be great for a dog that treats their toys more gently or for a human to use but since it is made for a larger dog and my dogs are medium sized, I have to give it 2 stars. Bummer cause it really flies incredibly.
customer_reviews.author: Sfbrock79

customer_reviews.title: It falls apart in the first day...
customer_reviews.text: This frisbee lasted maybe 3 tosses. It fell apart right away. I have a Border Collie and we play with frisbees all the time so we have tried a variety. This is by far the worst quality and craftmanship. I wanted one that floats in the water. It came undone and was shredding after the first few tosses and then the round foam came out. It literally just fell apart. I had to throw it out right away.
customer_reviews.author: KLC

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Attracts dirt like a magnet. First throw it was disgusting. The dog slobber gets on it then dirts sticks to the slobber and can’t be washed off. After the first or second time playing with it it started to become frayed along the edges. I lost my Kong frisbee so tried this one bc it’s supposed to float. Wish I still had the Kong, it was way more durable flew farther and rinsed of easy. The end
customer_reviews.author: the Mindful Wanderers

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, still alive after a month. Our athletic, year-old, 57 pound mutt has gone through several other cloth discs but this one is holding up very well. I even reward him with a little tug-of-war with this disc sometimes. Of course, it’s important to put the disc away after you are done playing fetch. Leaving it out for the dog to chew on is where most damage happens.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon N. Eck

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Really like this toy. My Heeler is really hard on plastic frisbees even the EXPENSIVE JAWZ brand. We have gone through about 4 of the JAWZ brand to one of these. I really like the JAWZ frisbees cause they fly so nice and far, but they get very sharp edges and she winds up cutting her mouth so they get thrown away for a new one. The Chuckit flys pretty far and is lasting longer than any other Frisbee type toy. Note: I wash/rinse all of the frisbees after each play as they get dirt/grit embedded in them that will wear out your dogs teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Vrock

customer_reviews.title: Died after 5 short play sessions
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the image, this toy is coming apart. I bought it on June 21 for a puppy that we picked up on June 23. Three weeks later, the toy has died. And we have not played with it much at all. We have gone outside with it a handful of times. In each case we have thrown the disc a handful of times. Today I noticed that it was fraying and you could see (and the dog could get) the foam material inside the edge. This is a badly made dog toy that comes apart almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: EDL

customer_reviews.title: Fun and durable!
customer_reviews.text: We are on our 3rd one of these! We do play pretty rough with it. My dog is a 75 lb. black lab, he loves it and it withstands his chewing for the most part. It's when he refuses to let it go and I have picked him up off the floor with it still in his mouth that it finally shows signs of wear. That's definitely not a rip on the product quality! We keep getting him a new one because the rubber frisbees, however more durable, are just not as fun or easy to throw and catch than this one!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Own a Dobey and he hasn't turn it apart yet. Had it about 2 months. We're both happy with it. UPdate: Our pooch is six months old and has all his big boy teeth and this product is as in tact as the day we bought it. It flys great and our dog loves it. Also bought a regular frisbee and it has been destroyed. This frisbee has been a bargain. Definitely worth buying>
customer_reviews.author: Dan & Robin

customer_reviews.title: A favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is my GSD's favorite thing ever. He's a bit rough on it, shaking it and pawing it on the ground, and it's held up well. This is our second one as I accidentally landed the first one on the roof. Oops!
customer_reviews.author: Drummer Girl

customer_reviews.title: We've been looking all over for this frisbee
customer_reviews.text: It's been a week and it still has life in it. I know that doesn't sound like much, but we count frisbee life in hours, sometimes minutes--never before in days with our super zealous Rottweiller/Shepherd/etc mix. Even professional-grade, fairly expensive frisbees have never made it a second day. The thing is, she absolutely loves catching frisbees and we love her acrobatics. I've just ordered three more of these. Besides being durable, this is just a great toy. It flies well, folds and packs easily and is soft in our hands and her mouth. Chomped up plastic toys are not great on your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sorenson

customer_reviews.title: Puppers love them
customer_reviews.text: To say our pups like these disks is an understatement. These are soft enough that they don’t hurt their teeth while still being able to catch some decent air. They always fly down and to the left (not straight) but our pups can still catch them. We buy a couple of these disks a year which is honestly pretty good for getting regular use at the park but they do get dingy pretty quick. On windy days we throw grounders which is equally as fun 👌🏼 Would last longer if we didn’t play tug but that is also a very fun game at our house so what are ya gonna do.
customer_reviews.author: atthemovies

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Boxer loves this toy. It is light weight, and made extremely durable. It has a soft design so as not to hurt your dogs teeth when she/he snatches it from the air. It flies well, so be wary of the wind on gusty days. She brings this to me, and prances like a show pony on successful catches. When she doesn't catch, it's usually my fault with a bad throw.
customer_reviews.author: Jaff  Moroby

customer_reviews.title: Dog's absolute favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this three times over the past 6 months. My dog loves it. Unfortunately if I turn my back, he destroys it pretty quickly - hence the 3 over the past 6 months. But he loves it and it's fun. He destroys everything though, stuffed toys, plush toys, hard frisbees, tennis balls, so I can't really fault this toy.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Real Flyer!
customer_reviews.text: So have had this just over a year, didn't use at first, have other soft frisbee's that we use. Of course once we started working and playing with this great flyer, our black lab/border collie mix wouldn't use anything else. Fly's really well, provided the wind isn't to strong, but in the 10 to 20 mph range throwing this little baby into the wind, it comes right back to me like a boomerang. Yes, I love it too, not just our dog. Very durable, once we're done playing this is put away for our next long range fetch session. Not a chew toy. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mtnman

customer_reviews.title: A good frisbee. Tougher than other ones I've used but ...
customer_reviews.text: A good frisbee. Tougher than other ones I've used but definitely not indestructible. It has a few holes in the nylon cover but the ring around the edge is still intact. For whatever reason, our dog still prefers ones that are more rigid. It's clear he has a preference for regular hard plastic frisbees. Next would be ones like Nerf for dogs that have a bit of a harder outer ring. The problem with those is that he bites through them almost instantly. The softer ring on this Chuckit disc is definitely more durable. I'm estimating it should last about a month with fairly heavy play.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip U.

customer_reviews.title: Easier on my dogs teeth/gums
customer_reviews.text: This frisbee is great for backyard catch with the pup. You aren't going to get super long distances out of this one, if that's what you're looking for. Being soft and stitched, this frisbee is much easier on the dog's gums and teeth than a traditional frisbee. That being said, I'm a little skeptical of the longevity of this product, as some of the stitches have already started to come loose after only a couple play sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Danger

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Loves It
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves the paraflight. We have purchased several over the years. Unfortunately, they are not very sturdy. They are usually destroyed within a week. Three stars because she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Made, Flies Well, Fun Awaits!
customer_reviews.text: Great dawg frisbee. Unforunately, our Standard Poodle is addicted to tennis balls and has little interest. We're thinking of taking away all tennis balls (withdrawal for Rosie) and re-training her with the frisbee! You will like this product and hopefully your dawg will, too. Woof!
customer_reviews.author: Determined 2 Learn

customer_reviews.title: Luna loves this thing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The dog is CRAZY about this toy. She will stand on the porch and bark her head off until I get it down and throw it. The only issue I had at all was that it wasn't flat when I received it so it always starts out straight when I fly it but turns to the left every single time. She has adjusted to it - even anticipates it but I wish the carton it came in was flat and not curved. Other than that, don't let them chew on it because as durable as it it, it won't last for very only if your dog (mine is a Doberman) doesn't give it back and decides it's MINE!!! LOL
customer_reviews.author: R. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great!!! Dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Great frisbee! I've bought frisbees in the past that don't fly straight but this one FLYS GREAT! The toy stays locked up when we aren't playing so that she doesn't sit and chew it but when she does have it she whips it around and can get pretty rough with it but it's held up so far The attached photo is the frisbee after about a month of usage. It has typical tooth marks and dirt but the stitching has held up as well as the rubber side
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works great! But.....
customer_reviews.text: So this is a fun and lovable toy. My Dog had a blast. Note 'Had' a blast as in past participle. Fun but no joke day one. After few hours of play. I went inside for a drink. Came back and my dog chewed right through it. So.... yea if you dog doesnt chew you can have fun with this... but... what dog doesnt chew?
customer_reviews.author: aeis

customer_reviews.title: My Dog's favorite toy !
customer_reviews.text: All we have to say is Frisbee and my dog dances and runs to the back door. My favorite thing is the ease of throwing this frisbee with a lot of hang time versus traditional hard frisbees. She can catch in the air 95% of my throws, and she loves to get it right! Bella gives this a five Woof rating !!!
customer_reviews.author: Capitan Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great for wearing out your dog!
customer_reviews.text: My pitty loves this and it flies great. I used to have to run all around (not bad for my exercise) going to get toys if my dog was too lazy to retrieve. He loves this so much, I have to chase him around to get it back sometimes!! Great, great exercise for him as I can really get it to go far. Next time, I will buy the two-pack since we also just adopted a Staffordshire bull terrier who was terribly overweight (read obese) when we adopted her. She loves this thing too and I attribute all of her weight loss to this toy. I would highly recommend and will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower

customer_reviews.title: durable, but not easy to throw
customer_reviews.text: i use this with my dog almost daily and it has held up well. it has survived tug of wars between my dog and his dog best friend. it's a bit tricky to get a long throw out of it but you can get the knack with some practice. had this one for 3 months now and is still in good throwing shape, when other frisbees we've had were destroyed by now.
customer_reviews.author: bitterguy

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: got this for my German Shepherd as he destroys plastic frizbees just by catching and biting, not even trying to chew. But the Chuckit is made with what feels like rubber on the outside edge and the other material is very tough. He has not done any damage to it, I've had it about a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Best frisbee out there!
customer_reviews.text: Our aussie loves this frisbee. We probably buy one every one or two months because between two dogs and the tug of war, it eventually kicks the bucket. But we are super happy with this frisbee and have been using this brand for our pup for over a year. It flies well, is super lightweight and is as durable as it could be. And it is more affordable to purchase it here than in store which will keep us coming back!
customer_reviews.author: Monique Belanger

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like this type of frisbee as they are great for training the dog to catch. The video attached shows how easy the dog can catch it. After 3 weeks at the dog park, you'll see that it gets destroyed - it's not very durable. But even torn up, it can still be throw. Would I buy it again? Possibly - the other frisbee shown is cheaper and is more durable
customer_reviews.author: tdgobux

customer_reviews.title: Excellent frisbee
customer_reviews.text: This Frisbee is great for your dog but it's also great to throw with friends! It flies VERY well and you can throw it very hard and not hurt someone. It has a nice soft surface. I recommend it for anyone... my wife and I have matches in the hallway of our home. It's a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R Woldin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing & durable!
customer_reviews.text: My Aussie is OCD about water fetch & he has not destroyed it yet; has lasted all summer long!! We leave it in the car & are always ready for swimming & fetching games. Soft to catch & the orange rim is great for spotting on the ground. Hopefully chuckit makes this, but with light up feature, would definetly buy that product!!! Only drawback is the chuckit lettering fell off after a few games, no biggy for us.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs G

customer_reviews.title: Our Labrador's favorite toy - and amazingly durable.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great product that ended up buying three. Our Lab loves this more than anything in the world (except food). Throws well, flies well, and the best thing is how durable it is. Even though she has it in her teeth, catching it mid-air, it holds up well and still flies on the next throw. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bret Waters

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fly correctly
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased these before and they were great. These were on sale and that is perhaps why they didn't fly well at all. They dove to the left every time. In fact we flew the old ones and they flew better than the new. Maybe they are using another manufacturer or they knew these were defective and put them at special price. Returned them for another brand that flew perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Barron

customer_reviews.title: My dogs absolute favorite. He would give it 10 stars.
customer_reviews.text: The Chuckit Large Paraflight (aka Frisbee) is by far without a doubt my dogs favorite toy/activity. I have a two yr old miniature Australian Labradoodle. He LOVES it. It is his greatest motivater and reward. He goes bonkers when ever I get it out. Lots of fun and exercise chasing & catching it. It has a foam ring edge stitched in under the heavy nylon canvas material. It's rigid enough to throw easily, flys great, and soft on his mouth & teeth. It also floats if thrown in water. And it's pretty durable. We have tried other brands and like this one the best. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Doggo Loved it While it Lasted
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loved this frisbee and seems way more inclined to catch it out the air than others we've used. He also loves trying to tear it to pieces more than any other toy he has so it only lasted about a week and a half. It gets really dirty and slimy quickly. Probably will try some other options on here before getting another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Drooks

customer_reviews.title: Not great for a real frisbee dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought this frisbee for our Frisbee dog and unfortunately it does not get good distance when thrown. It is more lightweight than I would like and it does not work for our dog. I have bought real frisbees for our dog that work much better.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid Halpern

customer_reviews.title: Drifts left, turns vertical, and then crashes!
customer_reviews.text: It’s soft on the dog’s mouth and it floats. That’s the good. The bad is that this thing flies like a lopsided turkey! It drifts to the left, turns vertical and crashes. If you have a dog that likes to fetch the frisbee in the air, this is a major challenge with this disk. Because this lopsidedness, we just lost this thing in the San Francisco Bay today. Time to get a replacement that has better flying properties.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Good throw, bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 year old blue tick coonhound with endless energy. He responds well to “drop” so there wasn’t any tug of war with this frisbee and it still only lasted 4 days before the foam roll came out from the popped seam. I loved the way it flew, though, so if you’re dog has a gentler hold, you may have more luck. I won’t buy it again
customer_reviews.author: LCwell

customer_reviews.title: dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 German Shepherds who absolutely love this. It is very durable! It is made from some type of canvas material with unbreakable stitching. My girls have used this as a tug toy numerous times and it still looks new. Chuckit is the only brand we buy. Great durable products!
customer_reviews.author: mark j. stidam

customer_reviews.title: Strong left turning tendency when throwing right handed.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. As others have complained, it's near impossible to fly straight. It has a strong tenancy to curve left near the end of it'll flight path, especially if throwing long. If you compensate by canting to the right, it'll travel a bit further, the curve to the left anyway.
customer_reviews.author: bumper

customer_reviews.title: Great flyer and floater.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item. Flies and floats great. It's not the most durable, but few things are with my 14-month labrador puppy. She goes crazy for this toy and loves it. But, I have to watch her, as she will chew it and tear the orange floatation ring around it. I have a few that are torn and still fly, but wobbly. She still loves them, but just watch aggressive chewers with this toy. It's durable, but not indestructible. And, it's kind of pricey, even for Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ARC

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart too easily!
customer_reviews.text: I love this frisbee-it flies really nicely, just the right weight. Our dog also loves them. Unfortunately, I feel like our most recent purchases haven fallen apart too quickly. Maybe two or three play sessions and the seams come undone and the foamy outer part come out. This did not happen to our first few purchases until after they had been played with a lot. It seems as though the quality has deteriorated. Our dog only gets to play with them under supervision, by the way. When she is done playing, we take them back and put them away.
customer_reviews.author: V. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed in one use
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepard isn't a destructive dog, most Frisbee will last at least a month. This one not so much. After one night of throwing it for him in the rain it got a hole in the blue foam. Now he loves this Frisbee and shakes it like a rug but I can't afford 7.50 a day in Frisbee fees. He loves the chuck it balls and they last.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Sara

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This is one of our dog's favorite toys, and she loves carrying it to the field and chasing after it. The problem is that she also loves to tug on it, and the orange fabric on the outer ring is made of a loosely knit webbing that comes apart pretty easily. After several days, she managed to pull the stitching out of it, exposing the foam inside. This would be a 5-star product if they would just change or reinforce the fabric so it doesn't come out so easily.
customer_reviews.author: DXLi

customer_reviews.title: Best “f-word” thus far for my boxer/pit buddy (jack)
customer_reviews.text: I have a 70lb boxer/pit mix that is the destroyer of frisbees. He’s ruined at least 10-12 assorted flying toys to the point of no return. Loves frisbees so much we have to say “f-word” instead of frisbee because he goes bonkers when he hears that word. Well.. this is by far the best one yet. It throws pretty good and it’s not so hard on his mouth when he catches it. This has been the longest lasting throw toy we’ve kept in tact thus far. Will definitely buy another just to keep in car for trips to the park.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica and Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great dog frisbee
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for a few weeks now. It's sturdy enough to withstand my large dog's chewing. Besides playing catch, I don't leave this around for him to chew though, so I can't comment on the longevity. For catch, it throws very nicely and is fun for me to just throw. Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: So we got the.package quickly. We've used it now since last Thursday twice a day and it is only Tuesday morning. So we've had it less than a week. If I could add a picture I would. It has fallen apart. The Orange trim is fraying around the edge. You can see the tubing inside. We throw it she brings it back that's it. Shakes it a bit. We throw 25 times in the morning and again in the afternoon. Very disappointed in this. Surely not worth the money. After only 11 different throwing sessions. It's crap. Pardon the language. And she is a medium size dog about 50 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: jeje

customer_reviews.title: The dog definitely likes it, but it does not fly like expected.
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves it- that's the important thing. It's not a disc we can use for tug-of-war, as that is my dog's favorite activity with a frisbee, but it has the advantage of being throwable in the house without marking the walls or breaking anything. Sadly, it does not have typical flying disc flight charactistics and resultantly is less than graceful when thrown. When we go outside and I throw it moderately hard, it flies no better than a paint bucket lid.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Adams

customer_reviews.title: Not up to task. Returned
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 sessions before my dog tore a stich and proceeded to unravel at will. I kept it out of reach except when we were playing but still couldn't save it. It is also hard to throw. It curxes to left no matter what you do (right handed) Other reviews said same thing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to catch.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this frisbee with my Aussie. He’s been able to catch it from about 12 weeks old. It flys much slower than a traditional frisbee and is easier to catch. It took 3 months for the first frisbee to get frayed enough that we got another. It doesn’t fly super straight but not bad for fabric.. definitely a great starter frisbee. Also a great frisbee for a smallish yard because of its speed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Wish it flew Straight
customer_reviews.text: Only have had it for a day. It's sturdy, and my dog (Aussie, rabid frisbee catcher) seems to like it, but it always seems to dive left (I am right handed). I can, however, throw it a good distance. In the end, I prefer the Flippy Flopper. They dont fly as far, but they float better and fly straight. I just wish my dog didn't enjoy ripping the flexible tube out of the edge of them so much!
customer_reviews.author: Livin'Large

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, great quality
customer_reviews.text: My dog and I love Chuckit products for their quality and durability and this Large Paraflight is no exception. I use this one on our trips to the beach and my yellow Lab can't get enough of playing with it. I should also mention this thing can take a fair beating since my lab played tug and war with this with one of her friends when they were unsupervised and other than one little puncture mark in the middle the Paraflight held up well.
customer_reviews.author: KulminhoTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It sure floats, but a bit wimpy
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it. She is not a super chewer but shakes it back and forth and it started tearing immediately. She likes that it floats, as she’s lost a few in the lake. It flies nicely though and she won’t knock a tooth out like her favorite with the hole in the center that she likes to carry with her face poking through. Wish it was made stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Mras

customer_reviews.title: My Dog's favorite toy.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy, and I'm glad it is easy on her gums/teeth. it is soft rubber. Easy to wash. These last my dog about two months. We are on our 4th one now. We go out to our yard to play with this at least three times a day, so I think this is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Hull

customer_reviews.title: My dog's favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: Our aussie loves this thing. A perfect trainer frisbee (although for some reason my dog is afraid of the real frisbees). If you allow the dog ot chew it, this thing could be destroyed by most dogs pretty easily. But if you just use it for frisbee and training and then put the thing up, it will last. Good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all!
customer_reviews.text: These are not durable at all. The seams fray and it comes apart. My dog is not allowed to chew on these and we keep it put away when not playing but we are on our 5th one in less than 8 months. However our dog is addicted so we’ll probably keep buying this inferior product until we can find a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in SR

customer_reviews.title: Stitching not reinforced
customer_reviews.text: We used the frisbee for one day and stitching unraveled the same day. Our dog did not chew it just caught it, brought it to us, and dropped it. We probably threw it 10 times for him. The zigzag stitching that keeps the foam ring of the frisbee is not reinforced in any way. This is the 2nd flyer we’ve purchased, same thing happened both times.
customer_reviews.author: nmskys

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold up for longer than 1month.
customer_reviews.text: I buy these all the time because they are light weight and my dog loves them.
customer_reviews.author: AngsandmKindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable, falls apart at first play
customer_reviews.text: Meh. It's a dog toy more than it is a frisbee. It doesn't fly well, and it comes apart way too easily. The first time we played with this there were already threads coming out and we re-stitched the threads but then the rubber started falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Dog parent in seattle

customer_reviews.title: Nice frisbee
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are loving frisbees. One of my puppies will bring me this one and the ChuckIt Squirrel together. I like to fry her head and toss them both at the same time to see which one she will chase. She will go after one, then the other. So far, it is a good one and I will probably buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Wendy M

customer_reviews.title: This is a phenomenal dog toy.  My friend's boxer loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This sweet dog paraded from room to room with his new toy showing everyone what he got and how thankful he was for it. He loves his new toy and can safely play with it for hours on end. Excellent pet toy! Will buy again if it ever wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Slushpuppy154

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Doesn't fly too far but ideal for catch with your dog. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MMartz

customer_reviews.title: Don’t last!
customer_reviews.text: Inconsistent seller. I purchased 1 at one a couple weeks ago and received 2, given that these only last 5 sessions of play I thought 2 for 10 was a good deal. So I ordered 3 the next time expecting to get 6, and I only got 3 for about 30.00. that is not a good deal because they don’t last. I won’t be ordering again!
customer_reviews.author: Willis

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight flier for easy game of fetch -- not for heavy chewers
customer_reviews.text: Know your dog! If your dog is a ripper/heavy chewer, this frisbee is not the one for you. It has lightweight foam around the circumference and a tarp like material covers the body of the frisbee. If your dog retrieves without much destruction, this is absolutely my favorite frisbee that I have purchased. It goes and goes with very little effort from the thrower.
customer_reviews.author: ambER

customer_reviews.title: One of the best dog toys on the market!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES this toy! She will chase after it and the vibrant color makes it easy for her to follow and find in the grass. It’s does fray after a while, but that’s normal for a dog toy of this nature. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Overall good, cheap frisbee
customer_reviews.text: My boy loved this frisbee for ~6 months. I was pretty religious about taking the frisbee from him after leaving the park because he likes to destroy toys, but I forgot to take it from him one time and this is the damage he was able to do in a single car ride home. Final word: It's worth it for the price, just don't leave your dog alone with it if you want it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Craft

customer_reviews.title: My dog destroyed this within hours
customer_reviews.text: It flies fine or it did, but it's not a sturdy toy and my 40lb dog tore it to pieces not long after it emerged from the box. So -- good if you can't throw a frisbee (my issue) but not if your dog is bent on destruction.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: Good dogbee
customer_reviews.text: Generally very good dog frisbee. My dog destroys toys in minutes but she’s leaving this one alone. It helps that she brings it back so I can throw it again. Deducted one star for poor aerodynamics. Maybe better if a bit bigger?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun But not lasting
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loved this. But as he got older he shook the toy and threw it for himself before he would come and drop it for me to throw again. Needless to say it was foam in the ring and broke super quick. I would say good for small pup or a soft mouthed dog, but not my 40lb Aussie.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Tears easily
customer_reviews.text: I have a Boxer/ Pit mix. Unlike a lot of his breed, he doesnt doesnt destroy his toys. Since this is an outside toy, we keep it pu up in the house so he can only have it when were outside. After only one use, the frisbee was started to frey. For such a big company, this is disappointing. My pup doesnt play tough so I would expect the quality to be better.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Dillinger

customer_reviews.title: Overall good!
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely LIVES for this frisbee. She will fetch it until her feet bleed, literally. It has received several rips but it's holding up pretty well, we only use it for fetch then it's put away. It curves sharply to the left after traveling some distance everytime I throw it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: This thing is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: A must buy if you have dogs that like to chase and catch, DO NOT buy the Flying Squirrel model. We both both and the Paraflight is great but the Flying Squirrel acts like a wet paper airplane. I could throw a beach towel further.
customer_reviews.author: Alex H.

customer_reviews.title: Catch 22
customer_reviews.text: This frisbee is great. Unfortunately I am scoring this item low only because my border collie could go through one every 3 weeks. It’s just not durable enough for a dog that loves to play catch as much as my dog. Tip: I rotate between this one and the slightly smaller diameter one with the hole in the middle so I can work him at different paces intermittently. It’s weird to be a person with a yearly frisbee budget. Good luck! Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: German Shepherd Approved
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this frisbee. She wont even let me carry it home from the park. She carries it herself. 😆 I wish the construction of the outer rim was a little not durable. After about a dozen trips to the park it throws wonky bc the rim isn’t rigid. But it’s definitely the best frisbee we’ve found to date.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 10 month old golden retriever and so far, so good! She hasn't chewed through it and loves to play fetch with it. It's very lightweight and easy to throw, and it's easy for her to catch--when I can throw it straight.
customer_reviews.author: lilacqueen75

customer_reviews.title: I love it, my dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my dogs favorite toy. I have a German shepherd that loves to run and fetch. It’s very light weight and goes far and easy for him to catch or pick up. I have bought about 5 of them asthe outter rings begins to give away and it starts to cause it to not go far or straight. It is a dog toy so that’s to be expected over time. I recommend it to everyone with has a dog that likes to run.
customer_reviews.author: chrystal r.

product_meta.title: Chuckit Paraflight Flyer Dog Toy Large
product_meta.description: Size:LargeChuckit!'s Paraflight Flyer features an aerodynamic design that descends gradually for engaging, long-distance games of fetch. The fabric frisbee is lightweight and buoyant, ideal for fetch at the pool or the beach for water-loving dogs. With a strong, multilayer nylon construction, the dog frisbee is built withstand rugged, extended play outdoors. For comfortable catching and carrying, the flyer has raised sides and a soft rubber edge. Designed with bright orange and blue colors, both pets and pet parents can easily spot the flyer in tall grass or on water. Available in small and large sizes, a wide range of dogs can enjoy fetch with the versatile Chuckit! Paraflight Flyer
feature_bullets: AERODYNAMIC FRISBEE: Ideal frisbee for dogs for high-flying games of fetch, designed for long-distance flight. The Paraflight fetch toy floats in water - great for playing at the pool or lake.
DURABLE DESIGN: The large dog frisbee features a multilayer nylon interior & soft rubber edges that's gentle on puppy's gums & teeth. Frisbee gradually descends for jumping & catching mid flight.

PET TOYS: Get ready for bonding & fun with your dogs & cats! Check out a variety of our pet toy products such as frisbees, perches & mirrors for birds, prey wand toys for cats, plush toys, light-up interactive toys & more.

CHUCKIT! FETCH TOYS: Chuckit! creates toys that enrich the human-animal bond & bright colors help dogs & puppies stay engaged. Checkout Chuckit! for ball launchers, bouncy balls, frisbees, indoor dog toys, glow toys & more!

JUST FOR PETS: Petmate makes a variety of pet products for dogs, cats, chickens & other small furry friends! Check out our brands such as Aspen Pet, Arm & Hammer, Booda, Chuckit!, Jackson Galaxy & more!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
